translated: The Elder Sattapadumi
“I lived on the bank of a river,
a brahmin called a hunter.🔽Having swept clean the hermitage
with flowers on a hundred petals,🔽I saw the One Perfected, golden-hued,
Siddhattha, the Leader of the World,

analyzed: siddhattham loka nāyaka  disvā nabhena gacchanta
translated: going through the sky,
and I was filled with joy.
Having gone forth to meet the One Perfected,
the Leader of the World, the Best of Men,
and having led him to the hermitage,
I sprinkled him with water from the lake.
For ninety-four aeons
I did not go to a bad rebirth,
this was the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the seventh of those aeons
there were four who were the best of feet,
endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great power.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Sattapadumi recited these verses.
